TopicTitle: What benifits do Engineers at levels 4 and 5 bring?

Articles.Content: This is the only class I haven't been able to find any information on.

They don't do anything right now. From the [wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Experience):

> 
> Level 0 engineers have no special abilities. At level 1, they can repack parachutes. At level 2, they can repair wheels. At level 3, they can repair lander legs. They gain no further abilities with additional levels

I think there were plans to let engineers calculate delta v but it wasn't done in time for 1.0. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Well it makes no sense to hold off a release due to one feature. It'll probably be in the next update. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
It makes no sense to release before you finish your game.
Engineers get a boost in efficiency and cooling of the drills and ISRU.

> 
> It makes no sense to release before you finish your game.

Wow, harsh. Clearly someone's never developed software before. If you really want to see craft dV (and not do the math yourself, which can get boring after a while), you can install Kerbal Engineer, which gives you nice readouts for that sort of thing. Engineer kerbals also get those readouts, which is very nice.

> 
> Wow, that seems...pretty lazy.

says the guy who couldn't be bothered to check the wiki, which has this information readily.

To be fair, he has a point. 

I use mechjeb which calculates dV. Also I made a custom flight window that shows my Ap, Pe and a couple of other things because it's annoying to have to switch to the map repeatedly for some basic information.
